title: Augmented Reality-Based Mathematical Experiential Learning: Exploration of Solids of Revolution

context.prior_knowledge: Calculus fundamentals (integration methods) and understanding of spatial geometry
context.additional_context: Hybrid learning environment simultaneously utilizing AR devices (tablets/smartphones) and Zoom interfaces

learning_goals: The process of generating 3D modeling of solids of revolution in an augmented reality environment can be explained.
Through AR visualization, integral formulas for calculating the volume and surface area of solids of revolution can be derived and applied.
Dynamic AR interactions can be utilized to analyze the geometric properties of solids of revolution (axis, cross-sectional area).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
